data.title: Great atmosphere!
data.text: Wonderful service. Wonderful staff. Excellent food and drinks.  Good prices. Everything under 15 dollars.

data.title: Lovely tea room
data.text: Have been here several times and never get bored with coming here.   Love the rich history and pictures to view. Brought my mother here for her 80th birthday celebration (her first visit).  She absolutely loved it.  Gave her the tour.   Was a little disappointed that they no longer have the shops upstairs.  Love their quiche and salads.   One of their specialties is their baked chicken salad.   They ran out that day.   It is a must try though.   Save room for dessert,  that is a highlight.   They do offer the birthday person a complimentary small birthday dessert.  Their bread pudding is one of the best.

data.title: A nice place for a ladies lunch
data.text:
This is not a place that I frequent but my wife has lunch there with some of her friends fairly often.  They typically have 5 to 10 ladies at any given visit.  The food is good.  The service is good.  It is typically busy.  My wife likes their peach cobbler.  They have inside and outside seating.  The place is an older home where the Becker family lived.  The last Becker to live there was Miss Aimee Becker.  

.

data.title: Ladies who lunch
data.text: I haven't been to Miss Aimee Bs in quite awhile.  It's looking a little more shabby than quant since the last time I was there.  Our server was a sweetie.  The food was ok -

data.title: Great for Girlfriends
data.text: A girlfriend of mine was visiting from out of town. She has four boys so we wanted to do  something girly. Food and service were good. Being a tea room I would like to see a lot more choices for hot teas. Their house sweet tea was very good. Will be back!

data.title: Long-standing establishment moves into the foodie age!
data.text: Congrats to Miss Amy B's for offering gf food selections and local where possible.  Been coming to this restaurant with my family for years and was so please to see heathy choices on the menu.  Love the new health baked goods and home-made protein bars (delish, by the way).  I like everything about this place with the exception of the restroom facilities!

data.title: Always go with a group of 5
data.text: This is a great place to celebrate something.  However, they don't take reservations for a group under 5.  So if you are a group of 2, it is hard to get seated and your experience isn't as nice.  Food is good.

data.title: Where Ladies Break Fast and Lunch
data.text: Quice was tasty, light and yet dense enough to feel.  Waldorf sald had an interesting twist with yogurt instead of mayo.  Nice selection of loose teas mostly black with one or two green and herbal.  Pleasant, personable service in a gussied up older home.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: My husband and I stopped by as we were driving through town. Quaint building, friendly staff and customers. My husband had chicken salad on pretzel croissant which was a special request and they were gracious enough to accommodate his request. His was delicious. I had their signature which is baked chicken salad. It was good but I would have preferred it in a sandwich like my husband had. The desert sampler was good,  had the butter cake, chocolate cake - both excellent but the tres leches was fair. Disappointed they didn't have moon cake. All in all, good but on the expensive side $55 without tip

data.title: Lunch
data.text: Was disappointed in the change of decore since it has new ownership. I didn't feel like it had the tea room atmosphere any more more of an artsy place with artist work for sale. I ordered a sandwich which was nothing special. Doubt if I will go back.Did check out the upstairs and it looked like they had a cute tea party room for a little girls party.

data.title: Charming old home where you can have some great food and the shopping is fun too.
data.text: I frequently bring out of town guests here so they can enjoy the charm of this quaint old home.  The menu is quite different.  Their lemonade made with milk is definitely different.  It's hard to decide between all of the salads, sandwiches and desserts .  We frequently "share" so we can have a sampling of all their food.  There are some little shops upstairs, too.

data.title: love, love, love this place!! The best breakfast, lunch & desserts all in one place!
data.text: Food is amazing - art work is mind blowing - coffee & tea is the best around - house is charming and very well decorated - service is extremely welcoming - highly recommend!!

data.title: Loved the house , and the food!
data.text: I've lived in St. Charles for 22 years and had NEVER been !  I've heard it about for years, but never had or took the opportunity to go.  Last week I went for lunch w/my daughter and granddaughter (age 3).  They have a large selection of menu items, and serve breakfast all day.  When asked if she wanted "French toast and bacon or mac and cheese" my granddaughter said "Mac and Cheese....and bacon".  So, she got both - they offered a side of bacon (2 slices for .99)  It was perfect for her.  I had 1/2 roast beef sandwich and a salad.  Both were very good.  My daughter had salad and pie (?) - which was actually like a quiche.  Don't remember exactly what it was called, but it's a regular on the menu.  Our waitress was good about checking to make sure we were doing ok, to refill drinks, etc.  I enjoyed looking through the house after we ate.  It's a very interesting old house .

data.title: Festive for the Holidays!
data.text: Our group enjoyed our holiday luncheon in this festive old mansion on the outskirts of main street in St. Charles.  It was like stepping into a Dickens novel.  The interior was warm and inviting and so festive.  The staff was fantastic.  Everyone at our table loved their food from home made soups, quiches and wonderful salads.  The desserts were divine and the tea selection was out of this world.  This was very special for our Merry Christmas luncheon....do not miss this tea room on your next trip to the St. Charles area.

data.title: Great place for breakfast or lunch and to enjoy artwork!
data.text: The atmosphere was pleasant, the food was amazing and the artwork was great.  Mark Twain never looked so good and the artwork gave the old style house some needed updating and a unique touch. I had the Quiche Lorraine and the Cranberry Bistro Salad along with a flavored ice tea.  Our meal was very fresh and we enjoyed every bite.  The desserts were amazing!  I have come here many years and heard that ownership had changed and although I always enjoyed my visits before  - the bar has been raised.  Not often do you find a local place that can do it right, but have lunch here and you won't be disappointed.

data.title: Quaint, lovely old historical home turned restaurant
data.text:
Always have loved Miss America B's.  It has a new ownership and I not quite sure if I like it as much as the old ownership.   Yes, the food is still delicious, but the portions seem smaller.   The desserts are still very yummy.
The new decor does not fit the grandeur of this historical home.   Apparently the new owner husband is a artist and they display his work throughout to try to sell.   It distract from the home original beauty.  The pictures/painting takes away the ambiance while dining.  Bring back the old decor and beauty.

data.title: charming quaint place for lunch
data.text: This is a very charming and quaint little place with so much charm. The menu has many salads and sandwiches. They also serve breakfast all day. I had the small salad with bacon, walnuts, mixed greens, red onions with a raspberry vinaigrette. I was surprised that they did not offer bread on the table. I think this would be a nice touch. My friends had sandwiches which looked very good. All in all I would recommend this place simply for the atmosphere. They also have cute little rooms upstairs with jewelry hats, and children's clothes and books for sale.

data.title: Still fabulous even under new ownership
data.text: Miss Aimee B's looks to be a traditional Victorian tea room, but it is so much more. Everything is made in house and tastes wonderful. There are different quiche on the menu every day and several soups as well. A wonderful and unique beverage is milk lemonade which is delicious! Make sure to save room for dessert as these are all made in house as well and are taste and decadent. I am a huge fan of a French dip sandwich and the offering at Miss Aimee B's is just about the best I have ever had. The bread is fresh every day and the meat was roasted to perfection. When you are looking for a lunch spot in St. Charles, give this a try!

data.title: Wish I Could Rate it Higher
data.text: It's such a charming place, I wish I could rate it higher.  But, the food isn't special.  We did have an exceptional waitress who almost made up for the very mediocre food.

data.title: Very nice place
data.text:
My wife loves to go here to eat. So I go with her sometimes. The atmospher is good and the food is very good!  

Especially for the ladies. If you want something a little different, give them a try 

They are very close to the old St. Charles area. Many shops and a lot of history.
